pr_title: docs: dependencies: Add pv to Fedora dependencies
pr_body:
kw deploy uses the pv command, which is not installed by default on Fedora. This makes it necessary to install the pv command during the setup process.

Closes #600

pr_title: src: kwlib: check if the context is inside a git worktree
pr_body:
In the functions get_git_config_regex and get_all_git_config, git produce an
error when kw mail -l is running outside a git worktree.

In order to avoid such error, the git config function checks if the context
is inside a git worktree and changes the scope to global.

Closes #551 

Signed-off-by: Maíra Canal <maira.canal@usp.br>
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 862352238, 'comment_body': 'We already have a function for handling this check; look at `is_inside_work_tree`. If you use it, you can delete `inside_git_repo` variable and change this conditional to something like:\r\n`if ! is_inside_work_tree; then`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 30, 12, 46, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Currently, kw deploy only works for Debian and ArchLinux families. This
commit expands kw distro support and adds Fedora-based systems as a target.

Closes #567

Signed-off-by: Maíra Canal <maira.canal@usp.br>

---

The remote and local deploy were tested on Fedora 35. VM deployment was not tested as I could not set up a VM with kw yet (even if other distros).

Unit tests are still missing and I'm currently working on them, but I decided to post the PR while developing them in order to get feedback from the kw community. Any feedback is welcomed!
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 881619911, 'comment_body': 'Let\'s use `if [[ ! -x "$(command -v $grub_cmd)" ]]` to be consistent with the code base.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 25, 12, 57, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 881620705, 'comment_body': 'Maybe we should check if `grub2-mkconfig` exists; if not, we should return an error and abort the deploy.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 25, 12, 57, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 881622261, 'comment_body': "Let's add simple documentation.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 25, 12, 59, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 881623890, 'comment_body': "I think we don't need to change this.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 25, 13, 0, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 881624723, 'comment_body': "Let's make `define_grub_cmd_update` return an error code in case we don't have anything, and check the return value here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 25, 13, 1, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889619028, 'comment_body': "Correct me if I'm wrong, but you assume that the developer system has grub, right? I guess this test will fail for the simple fact that the developer is using another bootloader such as u-boot or syslinux, right? I think you can mock some of the grub behavior with an alias in the test; that way, you can also test the `grub` and `grub2`. IIRC `device_test` and `utils_test.sh` might have some good examples.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 4, 21, 48, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889619654, 'comment_body': 'Could you add a test that hit this case?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 4, 21, 57, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rodrigosiqueira', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889693767, 'comment_body': "Currently, the test fails if the developer is using another bootloader. For example, all tests run fine on the CI/CD, but, locally with Fedora, tests are failing. I'll try to mock the grub behavior so that the tests can run system wide.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 5, 13, 37, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mairacanal', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889698866, 'comment_body': "Checking the `device_test` and `utils_test.sh`, I saw how mock was done on unit tests. But, I'm still running into a problem: even if I alias or export grub-mkconfig, `$(command -v 'grub-mkconfig')` cannot find the mock command and I end up falling into the case where there is no grub installed.\r\n\r\nHave you got any suggestions on what to do?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 5, 14, 29, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mairacanal', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889703228, 'comment_body': "End up getting a solution for the `$(command -v 'grub-mkconfig')` problem with `kwlib`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 5, 15, 14, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mairacanal', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 889703393, 'comment_body': 'Added!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 5, 15, 16, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mairacanal', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: src: help: Fix renaming of configm to kernel-config-manager
pr_body:
The commit 305d9e1 changed the command from configm to
kernel-config-manager, but didn't change the short command from g to k.
This commit fixes the new short command for kernel-config-manager
command and also reorganize the commands in alphabetical order.

Fixes: 305d9e1 ('src: configm: Rename configm to kernel-config-manager')
Signed-off-by: Maíra Canal <mairacanal@riseup.net>
